## Conversation that answers the provided question:
**User:**
I've been hearing that I should upgrade to v0.7.3-9 Verus CLI, but I'm not really sure what the big deal is. What happens if I don't upgrade, since it's not mandatory?

**AI Assistant:**
While it's true that upgrading to v0.7.3-9 Verus CLI is not mandatory, I would highly recommend doing so, especially if you're a notary, run a high peer count public node, or operate a pool. This version includes some important fixes that can affect the performance and security of your Verus setup.

For example, one of the fixes in this version addresses an issue with signrawtransaction that could sometimes cause countersigning a multisig, ID-based raw transaction to fail. Additionally, the new version introduces more immediate and effective bad node banning behavior, which can help maintain the overall health of the network.

While you might not notice any immediate issues if you don't upgrade, you could be missing out on these important improvements and potentially exposing yourself to security risks down the line. So, if you want to ensure the best possible experience with Verus, I would recommend upgrading to v0.7.3-9 as soon as possible.
What happens if I don't upgrade to v0.7.3-9 Verus CLI, since it's not mandatory?

While upgrading to v0.7.3-9 Verus CLI is not mandatory, it is highly recommended, especially for notaries, high peer count public nodes, and pools. This version includes important fixes, such as a fix for signrawtransaction that could sometimes result in failure of countersigning a multisig, ID-based raw transaction, as well as more immediate and effective bad node banning behavior.

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/
https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/## Verifying Downloads
A txt file containing the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature, is included for each download. These packages have been signed with the identity "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@".
1) Extract downloaded archive
2) Verify signature for the extracted archive using the extracted text file.
3) Extract archive to desired directory
### CLI examples
**Verifying file directly**
```
./verus verifyfile "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" ARJwGAABQSAEzdWu0ba5tX9dSzAPIJsuuYhh/+Fd4F3m0uPsQHLCWCr6PGjzCB+aC5uBtVxtheSL1ATWW6nDv6/OwyEDtK4V /Downloads/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.7.3-10-x86_64/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.7.3-10-x86_64.tar.gz
```
**Verifying using a checksum**
```
./verus verifyhash "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" ARJwGAABQSAEzdWu0ba5tX9dSzAPIJsuuYhh/+Fd4F3m0uPsQHLCWCr6PGjzCB+aC5uBtVxtheSL1ATWW6nDv6/OwyEDtK4V f99dfbd27d8b97eb14861d37371858c545a293e56ec8dd742ffa4f2365966af9
```**The result will be true if the signature is valid.**
```
true
```
